rules.natural: Whenever a scheduled audit occurs at Facility Alpha, it follows that if the facility possesses a valid permit, then it operates legally.
Either a scheduled audit happens at Facility Alpha or an unscheduled inspection occurs.
Under the condition that an unscheduled inspection takes place at Facility Alpha, then if the facility has a valid permit, it operates legally.
When major contamination occurs at Facility Alpha, then if it is not the case that a regulatory violation leads to temporary shutdown, criminal charges will be filed against the facility.
A batch recall of Drug X implies that major contamination occurred at Facility Alpha.
If supplier approval was granted for Chemical Y, then whenever Drug X uses that raw material and is manufactured at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.
Either supplier approval exists for Chemical Y or emergency procurement was used for it.
Under the condition of emergency procurement for Chemical Y, then if Drug X uses that raw material and is made at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.
If Drug X passes clinical trials, then it receives FDA approval.
Drug X passes clinical trials or it is manufactured at Facility Alpha.
If Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, then it passes quality control testing.
Under the condition that Drug X meets quality standards, then if it contains active compound A, it is safe for consumption.
If Drug X passes quality control testing, then it meets quality standards.
Whenever Drug X is investigated by the FDA, it indicates that the product was recalled.
Under the condition that it is not true that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha leads to safety given active compound A, a regulatory violation is committed by the facility.
Whenever it is not the case that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha results in safety with active compound A, then temporary shutdown does not occur at the facility.
Provided that it is not the case that Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or non-safety triggers FDA investigation, the facility holds a valid permit.
Under the condition that neither does Facility Alpha have a manufacturing license nor does non-safety result in FDA investigation, the facility does not operate legally.
If a batch recall does not happen for Drug X, then Facility Alpha committed a minor infraction.

facts.natural: Drug X contains active compound A.
Drug X uses raw material Chemical Y.
It is not the case that criminal charges were filed against Facility Alpha.
No minor infraction was committed by Facility Alpha.
Drug X does not have FDA approval.
Drug X was not recalled as a product.
Facility Alpha does not hold a manufacturing license.

target.natural: Drug X is safe for consumption.

Drug X is safe for consumption.
Provided that Facility Alpha has a valid permit, it operates legally.
If it is false that either Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or non-safety of Drug X leads to FDA investigation, then the facility operates legally.
Either Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or, if Drug X is not safe for consumption, then it is investigated by the FDA.
Provided that Drug X is not safe for consumption, it is investigated by the FDA.
Whenever Drug X is not safe for consumption, it is recalled as a product.
Drug X is safe for consumption.
A batch recall was issued for Drug X.
Major contamination occurred at Facility Alpha.

If Facility Alpha commits a regulatory violation, then a temporary shutdown follows.
Provided that it is false that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha implies that if it contains active compound A then it is safe, a temporary shutdown of the facility occurs.
Whenever Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, then if it contains active compound A, it is safe for consumption.

(A1 → G).natural: If Drug X contains active compound A, then it is safe for consumption.

(A11 → A10).natural: Provided that Facility Alpha has a valid permit, it operates legally.

(A12 → (A11 → A10)).natural: Whenever a scheduled audit occurs at Facility Alpha, it follows that if the facility possesses a valid permit, then it operates legally.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either a scheduled audit happens at Facility Alpha or an unscheduled inspection occurs.

(A13 → (A11 → A10)).natural: Under the condition that an unscheduled inspection takes place at Facility Alpha, then if the facility has a valid permit, it operates legally.

(A15 → A14).natural: If Facility Alpha commits a regulatory violation, then a temporary shutdown follows.

(A17 → (¬(A15 → A14) → A16)).natural: When major contamination occurs at Facility Alpha, then if it is not the case that a regulatory violation leads to temporary shutdown, criminal charges will be filed against the facility.

(A18 → A17).natural: A batch recall of Drug X implies that major contamination occurred at Facility Alpha.

(A2 ∨ (A1 → G)).natural: Either Drug X has FDA approval or, if it contains active compound A, then it is safe for consumption.

(A20 → (A4 → A5)).natural: Provided that Drug X uses raw material Chemical Y, then if it is manufactured at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.

(A21 → (A20 → (A4 → A5))).natural: If supplier approval was granted for Chemical Y, then whenever Drug X uses that raw material and is manufactured at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.

(A21 ∨ A22).natural: Either supplier approval exists for Chemical Y or emergency procurement was used for it.

(A22 → (A20 → (A4 → A5))).natural: Under the condition of emergency procurement for Chemical Y, then if Drug X uses that raw material and is made at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.

(A3 → A2).natural: If Drug X passes clinical trials, then it receives FDA approval.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Drug X passes clinical trials or it is manufactured at Facility Alpha.

(A4 → (A1 → G)).natural: Whenever Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, then if it contains active compound A, it is safe for consumption.

(A4 → A5).natural: Provided that Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.

(A4 → A6).natural: If Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, then it passes quality control testing.

(A5 → (A1 → G)).natural: Under the condition that Drug X meets quality standards, then if it contains active compound A, it is safe for consumption.

(A6 → A5).natural: If Drug X passes quality control testing, then it meets quality standards.

(A8 → A7).natural: Whenever Drug X is investigated by the FDA, it indicates that the product was recalled.

(A9 ∨ (¬G → A8)).natural: Either Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or, if Drug X is not safe for consumption, then it is investigated by the FDA.

(¬(A15 → A14) → A16).natural: If it is not the case that a regulatory violation at Facility Alpha leads to temporary shutdown, then criminal charges are filed against the facility.

(¬(A4 → (A1 → G)) → A14).natural: Provided that it is false that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha implies that if it contains active compound A then it is safe, a temporary shutdown of the facility occurs.

(¬(A4 → (A1 → G)) → A15).natural: Under the condition that it is not true that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha leads to safety given active compound A, a regulatory violation is committed by the facility.

(¬(A4 → (A1 → G)) → ¬A14).natural: Whenever it is not the case that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha results in safety with active compound A, then temporary shutdown does not occur at the facility.

(¬(A9 ∨ (¬G → A8)) → A10).natural: If it is false that either Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or non-safety of Drug X leads to FDA investigation, then the facility operates legally.

(¬(A9 ∨ (¬G → A8)) → A11).natural: Provided that it is not the case that Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or non-safety triggers FDA investigation, the facility holds a valid permit.

(¬(A9 ∨ (¬G → A8)) → ¬A10).natural: Under the condition that neither does Facility Alpha have a manufacturing license nor does non-safety result in FDA investigation, the facility does not operate legally.

(¬A18 → A19).natural: If a batch recall does not happen for Drug X, then Facility Alpha committed a minor infraction.

(¬G → A7).natural: Whenever Drug X is not safe for consumption, it is recalled as a product.

(¬G → A8).natural: Provided that Drug X is not safe for consumption, it is investigated by the FDA.

A1.natural: Drug X contains active compound A.

A17.natural: Major contamination occurred at Facility Alpha.

A18.natural: A batch recall was issued for Drug X.

A20.natural: Drug X uses raw material Chemical Y.

G.natural: Drug X is safe for consumption.

¬A16.natural: It is not the case that criminal charges were filed against Facility Alpha.

¬A19.natural: No minor infraction was committed by Facility Alpha.

¬A2.natural: Drug X does not have FDA approval.

¬A7.natural: Drug X was not recalled as a product.

¬A9.natural: Facility Alpha does not hold a manufacturing license.
